items.text: I often feel that I deserve special treatment.
items.rationale: A sense of entitlement is a core feature of narcissism.

items.text: I am preoccupied with fantasies of unlimited success and power.
items.rationale: Grandiose fantasies are characteristic of narcissism.

items.text: I believe I am a special person.
items.rationale: Believing oneself to be special is a hallmark of narcissism.

items.text: I often seek admiration from others.
items.rationale: Seeking admiration is a typical behavior of narcissistic individuals.

items.text: I have a strong sense of self-importance.
items.rationale: Self-importance is a defining trait of narcissism.

items.text: I am often envious of others.
items.rationale: Envy is commonly associated with narcissistic tendencies.

items.text: I like to be the center of attention.
items.rationale: Desiring attention is a common trait in narcissistic individuals.

items.text: I often think about how to achieve fame and recognition.
items.rationale: Fantasizing about fame is typical of narcissistic personalities.

items.text: I feel upset when others do not notice my achievements.
items.rationale: A need for recognition is a key aspect of narcissism.

items.text: I believe I am more capable than most people.
items.rationale: Overestimating one's abilities is a common narcissistic trait.

items.text: I often talk about my accomplishments.
items.rationale: Boasting about achievements is typical of narcissistic behavior.

items.text: I feel that rules do not apply to me.
items.rationale: A sense of being above the rules is characteristic of narcissism.

items.text: I sometimes exaggerate my achievements to impress others.
items.rationale: Exaggeration can be linked to narcissism but may also relate to social desirability.

items.text: I enjoy being in leadership roles.
items.rationale: While leadership can be a sign of narcissism, it can also relate to genuine leadership skills.

items.text: I sometimes manipulate others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Manipulation is a trait of narcissism but is also central to Machiavellianism.

items.text: I am skilled at getting others to do what I want.
items.rationale: Manipulating others for personal gain is a core aspect of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I believe that the ends justify the means.
items.rationale: This belief is central to Machiavellian thinking.

items.text: I am good at reading people to get what I want.
items.rationale: Understanding and exploiting others is a key trait of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I often use flattery to get my way.
items.rationale: Using charm and flattery is a common Machiavellian tactic.

items.text: I prefer to keep my true intentions hidden.
items.rationale: Secrecy and deception are hallmarks of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I am willing to lie to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Deceptiveness is a core feature of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I often plan several steps ahead to ensure success.
items.rationale: Strategic planning is typical of Machiavellian behavior.

items.text: I am not concerned with morality if it gets in the way of my goals.
items.rationale: Disregard for morality is a key aspect of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I enjoy outsmarting others.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from manipulation is characteristic of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I am often calculating in my interactions with others.
items.rationale: Being strategic and calculating is a hallmark of Machiavellianism.

items.text: I believe that people are generally gullible and easy to manipulate.
items.rationale: This belief reflects a Machiavellian view of human nature.

items.text: I sometimes use others' weaknesses to my advantage.
items.rationale: Exploiting weaknesses is Machiavellian but can also relate to psychopathy.

items.text: I enjoy being in control of situations.
items.rationale: Desire for control can be Machiavellian but also relates to leadership.

items.text: I sometimes act impulsively without considering the consequences.
items.rationale: Impulsivity is more characteristic of psychopathy than Machiavellianism.

items.text: I often do things without feeling guilty.
items.rationale: Lack of guilt is a core feature of psychopathy.

items.text: I am not easily moved by the suffering of others.
items.rationale: Lack of empathy is a defining trait of psychopathy.

items.text: I often act on impulse.
items.rationale: Impulsivity is a key characteristic of psychopathy.

items.text: I enjoy taking risks.
items.rationale: Risk-taking behavior is typical of psychopathy.

items.text: I am often bored and seek excitement.
items.rationale: A need for stimulation is common in psychopathy.

items.text: I have a history of trouble with the law.
items.rationale: Antisocial behavior is a hallmark of psychopathy.

items.text: I am often deceitful in my dealings with others.
items.rationale: Deceitfulness is a core trait of psychopathy.

items.text: I am not concerned with the feelings of others.
items.rationale: Lack of concern for others' feelings is characteristic of psychopathy.

items.text: I often disregard rules and social norms.
items.rationale: Disregard for rules is a defining feature of psychopathy.

items.text: I am often aggressive when provoked.
items.rationale: Aggression is a common trait in psychopathy.

items.text: I have little regard for the safety of others.
items.rationale: Disregard for others' safety is typical of psychopathy.

items.text: I sometimes act without thinking about the consequences.
items.rationale: Impulsivity is a psychopathic trait but can also relate to low conscientiousness.

items.text: I enjoy living on the edge.
items.rationale: Thrill-seeking is psychopathic but can also relate to high openness.

items.text: I sometimes enjoy seeing others in pain.
items.rationale: Enjoying others' pain is more characteristic of sadism than psychopathy.

items.text: I enjoy making others suffer.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from others' suffering is a core feature of sadism.

items.text: I find it amusing to upset others.
items.rationale: Enjoying others' distress is characteristic of sadism.

items.text: I like to hurt people who annoy me.
items.rationale: Inflicting pain on others is a defining trait of sadism.

items.text: I enjoy watching violent sports or movies.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of violence is typical of sadistic tendencies.

items.text: I sometimes enjoy being cruel to others.
items.rationale: Cruelty for pleasure is a hallmark of sadism.

items.text: I feel powerful when I cause others pain.
items.rationale: Feeling empowered by causing pain is characteristic of sadism.

items.text: I like to see others squirm.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from others' discomfort is a sadistic trait.

items.text: I enjoy humiliating others.
items.rationale: Humiliation of others for enjoyment is a core aspect of sadism.

items.text: I sometimes provoke others just to see their reaction.
items.rationale: Provoking others for amusement is typical of sadistic behavior.

items.text: I find it entertaining to tease others.
items.rationale: Teasing for entertainment is a common sadistic behavior.

items.text: I enjoy seeing others get what they deserve.
items.rationale: Deriving pleasure from others' misfortune is characteristic of sadism.

items.text: I sometimes enjoy being mean to others.
items.rationale: Being mean for enjoyment is sadistic but can also relate to psychopathy.

items.text: I like to play pranks on others.
items.rationale: Pranking can be sadistic but also relates to playful behavior.

items.text: I sometimes manipulate others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Manipulation is more characteristic of Machiavellianism than sadism.
